metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5735 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Debian backport of the fix for CVE-2017-3137 leads to assertion failure in validator.c:1858; Affects Debian versions 9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u15; 9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u18; 9.10.3.dfsg.P4-12.3+deb9u5; 9.11.5.P4+dfsg-5.1 No ISC releases are affected. Other packages from other distributions who did similar backports for the fix for 2017-3137 may also be affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17').
